How do places on Mars get their name? 

More than 2,000 locations on the Red Planet have official names, recognizing places on Earth, explorers, and even cartoon characters. Learn what inspires names for Martian hills, craters, and rocks: https://go.nasa.gov/3CmCYMm

In the early universe, the gas between stars and galaxies was opaque – energetic starlight could not penetrate it. But 1 billion years after the big bang, the gas had become completely transparent. Why? New data from @NASAWebb has pinpointed the reason: https://go.nasa.gov/3qCcOmn

Scientists detected a gamma-ray burst on Oct. 9, 2022, that they called the BOAT: Brightest Of All Time. Data from our @NASAUniverse NuSTAR telescope provided clues about the collapsing star that triggered this record-breaking event. https://go.nasa.gov/3qvQt9L

LIVE: After more than a week of science, outreach, and on-orbit activities, the all-private astronaut crew of #Ax2 is boarding their @SpaceX Dragon Freedom spacecraft to return to Earth. Hatch closure is scheduled for 9:10am ET (1310 UTC): http://nasa.gov/live

After just over a week in space, @Axiom_Space's #Ax2 astronauts are set to return to Earth on Tuesday, May 30. Here’s how to watch live coverage, from closing of the hatches to splashdown: https://go.nasa.gov/43vWzp6
